items.title: Campaign increases likelihood parents will ask about guns before a playdate
items.summary: The Asking Saves Kids (ASK) campaign is effective in increasing parents' comfort level in asking if there is a gun where their child plays, according to research.

alternate.title: Campaign increases likelihood parents will ask about guns before a playdate

items.title: Third and fourth graders who own cell phones are more likely to be cyberbullied
items.summary: New research suggests elementary school-age children who own cell phones may be particularly vulnerable to cyberbullying.

alternate.title: Third and fourth graders who own cell phones are more likely to be cyberbullied

items.title: Increasing number of children arrive at emergency departments addicted to opioids
items.summary: Showing the opioid epidemic knows no age limits, new research suggests more than 100 children test positive for opioid addiction or dependency each day in US emergency departments.

alternate.title: Increasing number of children arrive at emergency departments addicted to opioids

items.title: Injuries caused by firearms differ in rural or urban settings
items.summary: Researchers examining pediatric firearm injuries found that the age a child is injured by a gun is closely related to where he or she lives: the city or the country.

alternate.title: Injuries caused by firearms differ in rural or urban settings

items.title: Regions with stricter firearm laws experience fewer pediatric gun-related injuries
items.summary: Regions of the United States with stronger firearm legislation had lower rates of Emergency Department visits for pediatric firearm-related injuries, according to a new study.

alternate.title: Regions with stricter firearm laws experience fewer pediatric gun-related injuries
